io.github.rowak.nanoleafapi.schedule

Class Schedule

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.rowak.nanoleafapi.schedule.Schedule

  • public class Schedule
extends java.lang.Object
    A local interface for an Aurora schedule. Setter methods in this class will not have an effect on the Aurora.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Schedule(int id, java.lang.String setId, boolean enabled, java.util.Date startTime, ScheduleAction action, ScheduleRepeat repeat)
      Create a new schedule containing all its data upfront.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Schedule

        public Schedule(int id,
                java.lang.String setId,
                boolean enabled,
                java.util.Date startTime,
                ScheduleAction action,
                ScheduleRepeat repeat)
        Create a new schedule containing all its data upfront.
        Parameters:
        id - a unique integer identifier
        setId - a special identifier for the schedule made up of two random UUIDs separated by the delimiter "--" (formatted as: UUID--UUID).
        enabled - if the schedule is enabled or not
        startTime - the time when the schedule will start running
        action - the action to perform when the schedule is run
        repeat - the time and frequency for the schedule to repeat

    • Method Detail

        Converts a JSON string schedule into its corresponding schedule object.
        Parameters:
        json - the JSON string to convert
        Returns:
        a schedule object

      • getId

        Gets the schedule's unique integer identifier.

        unique integer identifier

      • setId

        public void setId(int id)
        Sets the schedule's unique integer identifier.
        Parameters:
        id - unique integer identifier

      • getSetId

        public java.lang.String getSetId()
        Gets the schedule's set identifier. This is a special identifier made up of two random UUIDs separated by the delimiter "--".
        For example: "9b6a491f-c290-452c-b9f4-9a3001278bc5--031f382b-497b-4823-995a-be4791d761c3".
        Returns:
        the set identifier

      • setSetId

        public void setSetId(java.lang.String setId)
        Sets the schedule's set identifier. This field is NOT required, and will be automatically generated if left unset. This is a special identifier made up of two random UUIDs separated by the delimiter "--".
        For example: "9b6a491f-c290-452c-b9f4-9a3001278bc5--031f382b-497b-4823-995a-be4791d761c3".
        Parameters:
        setId - the set identifier

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Checks if the schedule is enabled or not.
        Returns:
        true, if the schedule is enabled

      • setEnabled

        Sets if the schedule is enabled or not.
        Parameters:
        enabled - if the schedule should be enabled

      • getDateAsJson

        public static java.lang.String getDateAsJson(java.util.Date date)
        Converts a date object into its corresponding JSON string, while conforming to a JSON structure readable by the Aurora. This method is the inverse of getDateFromJson(String).
        Parameters:
        date - a date object
        Returns:
        the date in JSON string format

      • getDateFromJson

        public static java.util.Date getDateFromJson(java.lang.String json)
        Converts a JSON formatted date into its corresponding date object. This method is the inverse of getDateAsJson(Date).
        Parameters:
        json - the JSON string to convert
        Returns:
        the date object
